00023 /*
00024  * This program is in public domain; written by Dave G. Conroy.
00025  * This file contains the main driving routine, and some keyboard processing
00026  * code, for the MicroEMACS screen editor.
00027  *
00028  * REVISION HISTORY:
00029  *
00030  * 1.0  Steve Wilhite, 30-Nov-85
00031  *      - Removed the old LK201 and VT100 logic. Added code to support the
00032  *        DEC Rainbow keyboard (which is a LK201 layout) using the the Level
00033  *        1 Console In ROM INT.
00034  *        See "rainbow.h" for the function key definitions.
00035  *
00036  * 2.0  George Jones, 12-Dec-85
00037  *      - Ported to Amiga.
00038  *
00039  * 2.1  Chris Culbert, 25-Jul-86
00040  *      - Ported to HP9000 computers and modified commands to look more
00041  *        like the Zmacs editor used on the Symbolics.
00042  *
00043  * 2.2  Bebe Ly, 09-Jan-87
00044  *      - Added functions for global search and replace, query search
00045  *        and replace, and parenthesis matching.
00046  *
00047  *
00048  * 3.0  Chris Culbert, August 1987
00049  *      - Integrated with CLIPS tool. Added functions to do rule
00050  *        compiling and editor entry and exit clean up.
00051  *        Massive rearranging of code and general clean up.
00052  */
00053

00094 typedef struct  {
00095         short   k_code;                 /* Key code                     */
00096         int     (*k_fp)(void *,int,int);       /* Routine to handle it         */
00097 }       KEYTAB;

00100 /*
00101  * Command table.
00102  * This table  is *roughly* in ASCII order, left to right across the
00103  * characters of the command. This expains the funny location of the
00104  * control-X commands.
00105  */
00106 globle KEYTAB keytab[] = {
00107         { COTL|'@',setmark },
00108         { COTL|'A',gotobol },
00109         { COTL|'B',backchar },
00110         { COTL|'C',spawncli }, /* Run CLI in subjob.   */
00111         { COTL|'D',forwdel },
00112         { COTL|'E',gotoeol },
00113         { COTL|'F',forwchar },
00114         { COTL|'G',ctrlg },
00115         { COTL|'H',backdel },
00116         { COTL|'I',tab },
00117         { COTL|'J',indent },
00118         { COTL|'K',kill_fwd },
00119         { COTL|'L',EditorRefresh },
00120         { COTL|'M',newline },
00121         { COTL|'N',forwline },
00122         { COTL|'O',openline },
00123         { COTL|'P',backline },
00124         { COTL|'Q',quote }, /* Often unreachable    */
00125         { COTL|'R',backsearch },
00126         { COTL|'S',forwsearch }, /* Often unreachable    */
00127         { COTL|'T',twiddle },
00128         { COTL|'V',forwpage },
00129         { COTL|'W',killregion },
00130         { COTL|'Y',yank },
00131         { COTL|'Z',quickexit }, /* quick save and exit  */
00132         { CTLX|COTL|'B',listbuffers },
00133         { CTLX|COTL|'C',edquit }, /* Hard quit.           */
00134         { CTLX|COTL|'F',filevisit },
00135         { CTLX|COTL|'L',lowerregion },
00136         { CTLX|COTL|'O',deblank },
00137         { CTLX|COTL|'N',mvdnwind },
00138         { CTLX|COTL|'P',mvupwind },
00139         { CTLX|COTL|'R',filename },
00140         { CTLX|COTL|'S',filesave }, /* Often unreachable    */
00141         { CTLX|COTL|'T',compile_region },
00142         { CTLX|COTL|'U',upperregion },
00143         { CTLX|COTL|'V',fileread },
00144         { CTLX|COTL|'W',filewrite },
00145         { CTLX|COTL|'X',swapmark },
00146         { CTLX|COTL|'Z',shrinkwind },
00147         { CTLX|'!',spawn }, /* Run 1 command.       */
00148         { CTLX|'=',showcpos },
00149         { CTLX|':',gotoline },
00150         { CTLX|'(',ctlxlp },
00151         { CTLX|')',ctlxrp },
00152         { CTLX|'1',onlywind },
00153         { CTLX|'2',splitwind },
00154         { CTLX|'B',usebuffer },
00155         { CTLX|'E',ctlxe },
00156         { CTLX|'F',setfillcol },
00157         { CTLX|'K',killbuffer },
00158         { CTLX|'M',smatchb },
00159         { CTLX|'N',nextwind },
00160         { CTLX|'P',prevwind },
00161         { CTLX|'Q',temp_quit },
00162         { CTLX|'R',bkwrdrpl },
00163         { CTLX|'S',frwsr },
00164         { CTLX|'Z',enlargewind },
00165         { META|COTL|'H',delbword },
00166         { META|'!',reposition },
00167         { META|'.',setmark },
00168         { META|'>',gotoeob },
00169         { META|'<',gotobob },
00170         { META|'B',backword },
00171         { META|'C',capword },
00172         { META|'D',delfword },
00173         { META|'F',forwword },
00174         { META|'J',forwsearch }, /* To replace C-S */
00175         { META|'L',lowerword },
00176         { META|'R',bkwrdcr },
00177         { META|'S',querysr },
00178         { META|'T',compile_file },
00179         { META|'U',upperword },
00180         { META|'V',backpage },
00181         { META|'W',copyregion },
00182         { META|'Z',filesave }, /* To replace C-S */
00183         { META|DEL_KEY,delbword },
00184         { DEL_KEY,backdel }
00185 };

00187 #define NKEYTAB (sizeof(keytab)/sizeof(keytab[0]))
00188 
00189 static void PerformEditCommand(void *);
00190 
00191 static void PerformEditCommand(
00192   void *theEnv)
00193 {
00194         register int    c;
00195         register int    f;
00196         register int    n;
00197         register int    mflag;
00198         register int    rtn_flag;
00199         char            bname[NBUFN];
00200         int num_a;
00201         char *fileName = NULL;
00202         DATA_OBJECT arg_ptr;
00203 
00204    /*====================*/
00205    /* Get the file name. */
00206    /*====================*/
00207 
00208    if ((num_a = EnvArgCountCheck(theEnv,"edit",NO_MORE_THAN,1)) == -1) return;
00209 
00210    if (num_a == 1)
00211      {
00212       if (EnvArgTypeCheck(theEnv,"edit",1,SYMBOL_OR_STRING,&arg_ptr) == FALSE) return;
00213       fileName = DOToString(arg_ptr);
00214      }
00215 
00216    if(bheadp == NULL) {
00217 
00218         /**********************************************/
00219         /* Initial entry, set up buffers and pointers */
00220         /**********************************************/
00221 
00222         genstrcpy(bname, "main");                  /* Work out the name of */
00223         if (num_a > 0)                     /* the default buffer.  */
00224                 makename(bname,fileName);
00225         edinit(theEnv,bname);                          /* Buffers, windows.    */
00226         vtinit(theEnv);                               /* Displays.            */
00227         if (num_a > 0) {
00228                 update();                       /* You have to update   */
00229                 readin(theEnv,fileName);             /* in case "[New file]" */
00230                 }
00231 
00232         init_cmp_router(theEnv);                        /* Prepare the compile  */
00233         EnvDeactivateRouter(theEnv,"cmp_router");               /* router.              */
00234         }
00235    else {
00236 
00237         /**********************************************************/
00238         /* Return from temporary exit, reset necessary stuff only */
00239         /**********************************************************/
00240 
00241         (*term.t_open)();
00242 
00243         if (num_a > 0) {
00244            filevisit_guts(theEnv,fileName);
00245            }
00246         }
00247 
00248    sgarbf = TRUE;                          /* Force screen update  */
00249    lastbufn[0] = '\0';                     /* Make sure last name  */
00250                                            /* is cleared out       */
00251 
00252    lastflag = 0;                           /* Fake last flags.     */
00253 loop:
00254         update();                               /* Fix up the screen    */
00255         c = getkey();
00256         if (mpresf != FALSE) {
00257                 mlerase();
00258                 update();
00259                 if (c == ' ')                   /* ITS EMACS does this  */
00260                         goto loop;
00261         }
00262         f = FALSE;
00263         n = 1;
00264         if (c == (COTL|'U')) {                  /* ^U, start argument   */
00265                 f = TRUE;
00266                 n = 4;                          /* with argument of 4 */
00267                 mflag = 0;                      /* that can be discarded. */
00268                 mlwrite("Arg: 4");
00269                 while ((((c=getkey()) >='0') && (c<='9'))
00270                        || (c==(COTL|'U')) || (c=='-')){
00271                         if (c == (COTL|'U'))
00272                                 n = n*4;
00273                         /*
00274                          * If dash, and start of argument string, set arg.
00275                          * to -1.  Otherwise, insert it.
00276                          */
00277                         else if (c == '-') {
00278                                 if (mflag)
00279                                         break;
00280                                 n = 0;
00281                                 mflag = -1;
00282                         }
00283                         /*
00284                          * If first digit entered, replace previous argument
00285                          * with digit and set sign.  Otherwise, append to arg.
00286                          */
00287                         else {
00288                                 if (!mflag) {
00289                                         n = 0;
00290                                         mflag = 1;
00291                                 }
00292                                 n = 10*n + c - '0';
00293                         }
00294                         mlwrite("Arg: %d", (mflag >=0) ? n : (n ? -n : -1));
00295                 }
00296                 /*
00297                  * Make arguments preceded by a minus sign negative and change
00298                  * the special argument "^U -" to an effective "^U -1".
00299                  */
00300                 if (mflag == -1) {
00301                         if (n == 0)
00302                                 n++;
00303                         n = -n;
00304                 }
00305         }
00306         if (c == (COTL|'X'))                    /* ^X is a prefix       */
00307                 c = CTLX | getctl();
00308         if (kbdmip != NULL) {                   /* Save macro strokes.  */
00309                 if (c!=(CTLX|')') && kbdmip>&kbdm[NKBDM-6]) {
00310                         ctrlg(theEnv,FALSE, 0);
00311                         goto loop;
00312                 }
00313                 if (f != FALSE) {
00314                         *kbdmip++ = (COTL|'U');
00315                         *kbdmip++ = n;
00316                 }
00317                 *kbdmip++ = c;
00318         }
00319         rtn_flag = execute(theEnv,c, f, n);                /* Do it.               */
00320         if(rtn_flag == EXIT)
00321            return;
00322         else
00323            goto loop;
00324 }
00325 
00326 /*
00327  * Initialize all of the buffers and windows. The buffer name is passed down
00328  * as an argument, because the main routine may have been told to read in a
00329  * file by default, and we want the buffer name to be right.
00330  */
00331 globle void edinit(
00332   void *theEnv,
00333   char bname[])
00334 {
00335         register BUFFER *bp;
00336         register WINDOW *wp;
00337 
00338         bp     = bfind(theEnv,bname, TRUE, 0);              /* First buffer        */
00339         blistp = bfind(theEnv,"[List]", TRUE, BFTEMP);      /* Buffer list buffer  */
00340         wp     = (WINDOW *) genalloc(theEnv,(unsigned) sizeof(WINDOW));  /* First window        */
00341         curbp  = bp;                            /* Make this current    */
00342         wheadp = wp;
00343         curwp  = wp;
00344         wp->w_wndp  = NULL;                     /* Initialize window    */
00345         wp->w_bufp  = bp;
00346         bp->b_nwnd  = 1;                        /* Displayed.           */
00347         wp->w_linep = bp->b_linep;
00348         wp->w_dotp  = bp->b_linep;
00349         wp->w_doto  = 0;
00350         wp->w_markp = NULL;
00351         wp->w_marko = 0;
00352         wp->w_toprow = 0;
00353         wp->w_ntrows = (char) term.t_nrow-1;    /* "-1" for mode line.  */
00354         wp->w_force = 0;
00355         wp->w_flag  = WFMODE|WFHARD;            /* Full.                */
00356 
00357         /* Secret Buffer for CLIPS Compile output */
00358 
00359         CompileBufferp = bfind(theEnv,"[Compilations]",TRUE,BFTEMP);
00360 }
00361 
00362 /*
00363  * This is the general command execution routine. It handles the fake binding
00364  * of all the keys to "self-insert". It also clears out the "thisflag" word,
00365  * and arranges to move it to the "lastflag", so that the next command can
00366  * look at it. Return the status of command.
00367  */
00368 globle int execute(
00369   void *theEnv,
00370   int c,
00371   int f,
00372   int n)
00373 {
00374         register KEYTAB *ktp;
00375         register int    status;
00376 
00377         ktp = &keytab[0];                       /* Look in key table.   */
00378         while (ktp < &keytab[NKEYTAB]) {
00379                 if (ktp->k_code == c) {
00380                         thisflag = 0;
00381                         status   = (*ktp->k_fp)(theEnv,f, n);
00382                         lastflag = thisflag;
00383                         return (status);
00384                 }
00385                 ++ktp;
00386         }
00387 
00388         /*
00389          * If a space was typed, fill column is defined, the argument is non-
00390          * negative, and we are now past fill column, perform word wrap.
00391          */
00392         if (c == ' ' && fillcol > 0 && n>=0 && getccol(FALSE) > fillcol)
00393                 wrapword(theEnv);
00394 
00395         if ((c>=0x20 && c<=0x7E)                /* Self inserting.      */
00396         ||  (c>=0xA0 && c<=0xFE)) {
00397                 if (n <= 0) {                   /* Fenceposts.          */
00398                         lastflag = 0;
00399                         return (n<0 ? FALSE : TRUE);
00400                 }
00401                 thisflag = 0;                   /* For the future.      */
00402                 status   = linsert(theEnv,n, c);
00403                 lastflag = thisflag;
00404                 return (status);
00405         }
00406         lastflag = 0;                           /* Fake last flags.     */
00407         return (FALSE);
00408 }
00409 
00410 /*
00411  * Read in a key.
00412  * Do the standard keyboard preprocessing. Convert the keys to the internal
00413  * character set.
00414  */
00415 globle int getkey()
00416 {
00417         register int    c;
00418 
00419         c = (*term.t_getchar)();
00420         if ((c & META) == META) return(c);
00421 
00422 #if WIN_MVC || WIN_BTC || WIN_GCC
00423         if (c > 255) {
00424          switch (c) {
00425             case UP_ARROW    :
00426                               return (COTL | 'P');
00427             case DOWN_ARROW  :
00428                               return (COTL | 'N');
00429             case LEFT_ARROW  :
00430                               return (COTL | 'B');
00431             case RIGHT_ARROW :
00432                               return (COTL | 'F');
00433             case PGUP_KEY    :
00434                               return (META | 'V');
00435             case PGDN_KEY    :
00436                               return (COTL | 'V');
00437             case HOME_KEY    :
00438                               return (META | '<');
00439             case END_KEY     :
00440                               return (META | '>');
00441             case COTL_LEFT_ARROW  :
00442                               return (META | 'B');
00443             case COTL_RIGHT_ARROW :
00444                               return (META | 'F');
00445             case COTL_AT_SIGN     :
00446                               return (COTL | '@');
00447             default :
00448                               return (COTL | 'G');
00449             }
00450         }
00451 #endif
00452 
00453         if (c == METACH) {                      /* Apply M- prefix      */
00454                 c = getctl();
00455                 return (META | c);
00456         }
00457 
00458         if (c>=0x00 && c<=0x1F)                 /* C0 control -> C-     */
00459                 c = COTL | (c+'@');
00460         return (c);
00461 }
00462 
00463 /*
00464  * Get a key.
00465  * Apply control modifications to the read key.
00466  */
00467 globle int getctl()
00468 {
00469         register int    c;
00470         c = (*term.t_getchar)();
00471         if (c>='a' && c<='z')                   /* Force to upper       */
00472                 c -= 0x20;
00473         if (c>=0x00 && c<=0x1F)                 /* C0 control -> C-     */
00474                 c = COTL | (c+'@');
00475         return (c);
00476 }
00477 
00478 /*
00479  * Fancy quit command, as implemented by Norm. If the current buffer has
00480  * changed do a write current buffer and exit emacs, otherwise simply exit.
00481  */
00482 globle int quickexit(
00483   void *theEnv,
00484   int f,
00485   int n)
00486   {
00487    if ((curbp->b_flag&BFCHG) != 0          /* Changed.             */
00488         && (curbp->b_flag&BFTEMP) == 0)         /* Real.                */
00489      filesave(theEnv,f, n);
00490    return(edquit(theEnv,f, n));                     /* conditionally quit   */
00491   }
00492 
00493 /*
00494  * Quit command. If an argument, always quit. Otherwise confirm if a buffer
00495  * has been changed and not written out. Normally bound to "C-X C-C".
00496  */
00497 #if WIN_BTC
00498 #pragma argsused
00499 #endif
00500 globle int edquit(
00501   void *theEnv,
00502   int f,
00503   int n)
00504   {
00505         register int    s;
00506 
00507         if (f != FALSE                          /* Argument forces it.  */
00508         || anycb() == FALSE                     /* All buffers clean.   */
00509                                                 /* User says it's OK.   */
00510         || (s=mlyesno(theEnv,"Modified Buffers! Quit")) == TRUE) {
00511                 vttidy();
00512                 full_cleanup(theEnv);
00513                 return(EXIT);
00514         }
00515         return (s);
00516 }
00517 
00518 /*
00519  * Temporary exit from editor. Leave all data structures
00520  * intact, but tidy up video interface.
00521  * Connected to "C-X Q".
00522  */
00523 
00524 #if WIN_BTC
00525 #pragma argsused
00526 #endif
00527 globle int temp_quit(
00528   void *theEnv,
00529   int f,
00530   int n)
00531   {
00532    vttidy();
00533    return(EXIT);
00534   }
00535 
00536 /*
00537  * Begin a keyboard macro.
00538  * Error if not at the top level in keyboard processing. Set up variables and
00539  * return.
00540  */
00541 #if WIN_BTC
00542 #pragma argsused
00543 #endif
00544 globle int ctlxlp(
00545   void *theEnv,
00546   int f,
00547   int n)
00548   {
00549    if (kbdmip!=NULL || kbdmop!=NULL) 
00550      {
00551       mlwrite("Not now");
00552       return (FALSE);
00553      }
00554    mlwrite("[Start macro]");
00555    kbdmip = &kbdm[0];
00556    return (TRUE);
00557   }
00558 
00559 /*
00560  * End keyboard macro. Check for the same limit conditions as the above
00561  * routine. Set up the variables and return to the caller.
00562  */
00563 #if WIN_BTC
00564 #pragma argsused
00565 #endif
00566 globle int ctlxrp(
00567   void *theEnv,
00568   int f,
00569   int n)
00570   {
00571    if (kbdmip == NULL)
00572      {
00573       mlwrite("Not now");
00574       return (FALSE);
00575      }
00576    mlwrite("[End macro]");
00577    kbdmip = NULL;
00578    return (TRUE);
00579   }
00580 
00581 /*
00582  * Execute a macro.
00583  * The command argument is the number of times to loop. Quit as soon as a
00584  * command gets an error. Return TRUE if all ok, else FALSE.
00585  */
00586 #if WIN_BTC
00587 #pragma argsused
00588 #endif
00589 globle int ctlxe(
00590   void *theEnv,
00591   int f,
00592   int n)
00593 {
00594         register int    c;
00595         register int    af;
00596         register int    an;
00597         register int    s;
00598 
00599         if (kbdmip!=NULL || kbdmop!=NULL) {
00600                 mlwrite("Not now");
00601                 return (FALSE);
00602         }
00603         if (n <= 0)
00604                 return (TRUE);
00605         do {
00606                 kbdmop = &kbdm[0];
00607                 do {
00608                         af = FALSE;
00609                         an = 1;
00610                         if ((c = *kbdmop++) == (COTL|'U')) {
00611                                 af = TRUE;
00612                                 an = *kbdmop++;
00613                                 c  = *kbdmop++;
00614                         }
00615                         s = TRUE;
00616                 } while (c!=(CTLX|')') && (s=execute(theEnv,c, af, an))==TRUE);
00617                 kbdmop = NULL;
00618         } while (s==TRUE && --n);
00619         return (s);
00620 }
00621 
00622 /*
00623  * Abort.
00624  * Beep the beeper. Kill off any keyboard macro, etc., that is in progress.
00625  * Sometimes called as a routine, to do general aborting of stuff.
00626  */
00627 #if WIN_BTC
00628 #pragma argsused
00629 #endif
00630 globle int ctrlg(
00631   void *theEnv,
00632   int f,
00633   int n)
00634   {
00635    (*term.t_beep)();
00636    if (kbdmip != NULL)
00637      {
00638       kbdm[0] = (CTLX|')');
00639       kbdmip  = NULL;
00640      }
00641    return (ABORT);
00642   }
00643 
00644 globle void full_cleanup(
00645   void *theEnv)
00646 {
00647 
00648 /*   Clear all data structures */
00649 
00650    kill_all_buffers(theEnv,&bheadp);     /* Clear all existing buffers   */
00651 
00652    kill_all_windows(theEnv);           /* Clear all windows            */
00653 
00654    kill_video_buffers(theEnv);   /* Kill special video buffers   */
00655 
00656    kill_cmp_router(theEnv);              /* Get rid of special router    */
00657 
00658 /*   Clear all global pointers */
00659 
00660    curwp  = NULL;                /* Current window               */
00661    curbp  = NULL;                /* Current buffer               */
00662    wheadp = NULL;                /* Head of list of windows      */
00663    bheadp = NULL;                /* Head of list of buffers      */
00664    blistp = NULL;                /* Buffer for C-X C-B           */
00665    kbdmip = NULL;                /* Input pointer for above      */
00666    kbdmop = NULL;                /* Output pointer for above     */
00667    pat[0] = '\0';                /* Search pattern               */
00668    lastbufn[0] = '\0';           /* Name of Last buffer accessed */
00669    CompileBufferp = NULL;        /* CLIPS Compile Output Buffer  */
00670 }
00671 
00672 /*
00673  * Dispose of all buffers. Clear the buffer (ask first
00674  * if the buffer has been changed). Then free the header
00675  * line and the buffer header. Called for full cleanup.
00676  */
00677 
00678 globle int kill_all_buffers(
00679   void *theEnv,
00680   BUFFER **top_buf)
00681   {
00682    register BUFFER *bp;
00683 
00684    bp = *top_buf;
00685    while(bp != NULL) {
00686         spec_clear(theEnv,bp);                         /* Blow text away.      */
00687 
00688         genfree(theEnv,(void *) bp->b_linep,           /* And free pointer     */
00689                 (unsigned)  sizeof(LINE)+ bp->b_linep->l_size);
00690 
00691         *top_buf = bp->b_bufp;                       /* Find next buffer     */
00692         genfree(theEnv,(void *) bp, (unsigned) sizeof(BUFFER));   /* Release buffer block */
00693         bp = *top_buf;
00694         }
00695 
00696    return (TRUE);
00697 }
00698 
00699 globle int kill_all_windows(
00700   void *theEnv)
00701 {
00702    register WINDOW *wp;
00703    register WINDOW *wp1;
00704 
00705    wp = wheadp;
00706    while(wp != NULL) {
00707         wp1 = wp->w_wndp;
00708         genfree(theEnv,(void *) wp, (unsigned) sizeof(WINDOW));
00709         wp  = wp1;
00710         }
00711 
00712    return (TRUE);
00713 }
00714 
00715 /*
00716  * This routine blows away all of the text in a
00717  * buffer. Does NOT care if text has been changed!
00718  */
00719 
00720 globle int spec_clear(
00721   void *theEnv,
00722   BUFFER *bp)
00723 {
00724         register LINE   *lp;
00725 
00726         bp->b_flag  &= ~BFCHG;                  /* Not changed          */
00727         while ((lp=lforw(bp->b_linep)) != bp->b_linep)
00728                 lfree(theEnv,lp);
00729         bp->b_dotp  = bp->b_linep;              /* Fix "."              */
00730         bp->b_doto  = 0;
00731         bp->b_markp = NULL;                     /* Invalidate "mark"    */
00732         bp->b_marko = 0;
00733         return (TRUE);
00734 }
00735 
00736 globle void EditCommand(
00737   void *theEnv)
00738   {
00739    void (*redrawScreenFunction)(void *);
00740    void (*pauseEnvFunction)(void *);
00741    void (*continueEnvFunction)(void *,int);
00742       
00743    redrawScreenFunction = GetRedrawFunction(theEnv);
00744    pauseEnvFunction = GetPauseEnvFunction(theEnv);
00745    continueEnvFunction = GetContinueEnvFunction(theEnv);
00746    
00747    if (pauseEnvFunction != NULL) (*pauseEnvFunction)(theEnv) ;
00748    PerformEditCommand(theEnv);
00749    if (continueEnvFunction != NULL) (*continueEnvFunction)(theEnv,0) ;
00750    if (redrawScreenFunction != NULL) (*redrawScreenFunction)(theEnv) ;
00751   }
00752 
00753 /*******************************************/
00754 /* EditorFunctionDefinition:               */
00755 /*******************************************/
00756 globle void EditorFunctionDefinition(
00757   void *theEnv)
00758   {
00759    EnvDefineFunction2(theEnv,"edit",'v', PTIEF EditCommand,"EditCommand", "*1k");
00760   }

00765 globle void EditorFunctionDefinition(void *);
